qas.question: What famous writers have lived in Tucson?

answers.text: Edward Abbey, Erskine Caldwell, Barbara Kingsolver and David Foster Wallace
a publisher of poetry books in trade and book arts editions

qas.question: What does the University of Arizona Poetry Center offer?

answers.text: a sizable poetry library and presents readings, conferences, and workshops

qas.question: What university were some of Tucson's famous writers associated with?

context: The accomplished and awarded writers (poets, novelists, dramatists, nonfiction writers) who have lived in Tucson include <a0_0>Edward Abbey, Erskine Caldwell, Barbara Kingsolver and David Foster Wallace<a0_0/>. Some were associated with the <a3_0>University of Arizona<a3_0/>, but many were independent writers who chose to make Tucson their home. The city is particularly active in publishing and presenting contemporary innovative poetry in various ways. Examples are the Chax Press, <a1_0>a publisher of poetry books in trade and book arts editions<a1_0/>, and the University of Arizona Poetry Center, which has <a2_0>a sizable poetry library and presents readings, conferences, and workshops<a2_0/>.
